entries = xml.etree.ElementTree.fromstring(xml_data)

for entry in entries.findall('.//entry'):
    title = entry.find('.//title').text
    content = entry.find('.//content').text
    timestamp = entry.find('.//updated').text

    print(f'{timestamp}\n{title}\n{content}\n')
    print()
    ```

After running the script, the output will display the title, content, and timestamp for each entry in the XML data.```

The title, content, and timestamp are extracted using XPath expressions to locate the specific elements within the XML structure. This allows you to easily access and display the relevant information from each entry.
